The best way to lose weight without exercising is by counting calories. The type and amount of food we eat determine how many calories we consume. For people on a weight-loss diet, the number of calories in a food is a deciding factor in choosing whether or not to eat it. There are several websites that make calorie counting easy. The one I use is My Fitness Pal https://www.myfitnesspal.com/ To begin you must know how many calories you can consume to remain at your current weight. Recommended calorie intake depends on factors such as age, size, height, sex, lifestyle, and overall general health. You can easily do a Google search to find out how many calories you need to maintain your current weight, however, recommended daily calorie intakes in the US are around 2,500 for men and 2,000 for women. By counting calories and knowing how many calories are in each meal you can then figure out how much food you can eat everyday and not gain weight. If you enjoy eating sausage, biscuit and gravy with pancakes for breakfast, followed by a Big Mac meal for lunch and steak and potatoes for dinner chances are you will easily exceed the amount of recommend calorie intake for your day and you will not lose weight but gain weight instead. Counting calories is not just a matter of what we eat, but how much we burn, too. Below are tips for burning energy and losing weight more effectively. 1. Eat breakfast: A protein and healthy fat breakfast can keep you full for longer and help prevent snacking during the day. 2. Eat regular meals: This can help you burn calories more effectively and helps prevent mindless snacking. 3. Remember your "five-a-day:" Fruits and vegetables can be a tasty snack and they can bulk out your meals. They are high in nutrients and fiber and low in calories and fat. A 500-calorie meal consisting of fruits and vegetables has more health benefits and will keep you feeling full for longer than a 500-calorie snack of pop 4. Drink water: It is healthful, has no calories, and can fill you up. Avoid alcohol and sodas as these can easily provide far too many calories. If you crave sweet drinks, choose unsweetened fruit juices, or better still, get a juice maker. 5. Exercise: If you find you enjoy eating like I do, exercise is a great way to allow yourself the guilt-free pleasure of eating more. As an example, if you exercise on an elliptical machine for one hour, you will burn between 900-1000 calories. If you count calories burning that extra 900 calories results in you having that milk shake you so crave. 6. Eat more fiber: Fiber, found in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains, can help you feel full and encourage healthy digestion. 7. Check the label: Some items have hidden fats or sugars. "Ten percent less fat," might not actually mean very much less fat, and it does not necessarily mean that you can eat more of it or that it is really more healthful. If you are counting calories, the label will help you keep track. 8. Use smaller plates: Research indicates that portion sizes have increased over the last 3 decades, and this may contribute to obesity. Using a smaller plate encourages smaller portions. 9. Slow down: Eat slowly and rest between courses or extra servings, as it can take 20 to 30 minutes for your body to realize it feels full. 10. Make a shopping list: Plan a week of healthful meals and snacks, list the ingredients you need, and when you go grocery shopping, stick to it. 11. A little of what you fancy: Banning foods can lead to cravings and bingeing. Spoil yourself occasionally with a favorite treat, but in smaller amounts. 12. Get enough sleep: Sleep loss affects the metabolism, and it has been linked to weight gain. 13. Avoid eating 2 hours before bed: Eating within 2 hours of sleeping can interfere with sleep quality and promote weight gain. 14. Eat a more protein diet and less carbohydrate (carbs) diet Examples of protein include eggs, nuts, poultry, oats, Greek yogurt, milk, lean beef, fish, beans and legumes. Example of carbs would be snacks we love to eat such as potato chips, nuggets, cookies, French fries, sodas, pastries, pancakes, corn syrup, hot dogs and sugary cereals are all bad carbohydrates in disguise. The bottom line is have a plan and stick to it. Start moderately; do not try to limit your daily calorie to 1500 per day. You will most likely end up tired, hungry, and irritable. It is best to also couple your calorie counting with moderate exercise. You will soon learn doing a little bit of exercise allows you to have that piece of cake staring at you from the counter. Sources: https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/245588.php https://www.nhs.uk/live-well/healthy-weight/12-tips-to-help-you-lose-weight/ http://www.med-health.net/Examples-Of-Carbohydrates.html https://www.healthline.com/nutrition/20-delicious-high-protein-foods#section20

That’s a great question! You know, exercising is super important. But you shouldn’t exercise to lose weight. Because that’s going to create stress in your body + you won’t see results and you’ll get frustrated. You should exercise because you like it. Even if you start with 10 minutes a day. What exercising does, is that it releases stress, it boosts your dopamine level, and it syncs your bodily functions (breathing, heartbeat, blood flow, etc). And that’s how it helps you lose weight (rather than by burning fat). That being said, I barely exercise, and here’s how I lost weight and how you can too!! (I’ll keep it short so DM me if you want more info, I’ll be glad to answer your questions :) ). Intermittent fasting: great because 1) you burn fat when you’re not eating, 2) it regulates your metabolism, 3) you learn to stop putting things in your mouth all the time (this one was big for me)Don’t eat meat AND carbs at the same time. Because the former needs an acidic environment to be digested while the latter needs an alkaline environment. In other words, eating both in the same meal confuses your body and slows down your digestive system.Try not to eat gluten and sugar more than 20% of the time. Because they mess up your digestive system and your hormone production. And you need those to work well in order to lose weight!! On the other hand, eat foods that heal your guts (search them on Google).Eat intuitively (aka, listen. I have a great “daily journal” that I used to learn that. I can send it to you if you want.Think and behave like you’ve already lost the weight. This one is the biggest advice I can give you. Basically, your personality drives your choices. And your personality is made of your thoughts, your actions and your feelings. When you start thinking and behaving like you’re already fit, you obviously change your thoughts, but also your feelings (because your mind doesn’t know the difference between your reality and your imagination). After a while, that’s going to impact your actions as well. And then making healthy choices will come naturally to you. Of course that’s a super simplified summary and there’s more to it. But just remember that that’s one way to rewire your brain to think like a fit person’s brain.If you find that you don’t have the “willpower” to follow this plan, this means you have deeper blocks you gotta work on. To give you an example, I was super addicted to sugar for years, and I had to work on that first. Otherwise I would have never been able to do intermittent fasting and eat intuitively hahah If that’s the case, DM me and I’ll tell you how you can heal your mind to remove those blocks :)

If you want to lose weight and keep maintaining it without doing exercise, you should follow easy lifestyle habits. Here are these 5 best easy lifestyle habits which will help you to lose your weight naturally. #1. Live Regularly  You don’t need to starve and you don’t have to exercise, either! An Irregular lifestyle breaks your circadian rhythm and stimulates your appetites so that you feel more hungry even when you are full. Therefore, if you follow a regular eating time and bedtime, you can lose weight naturally by just restoring your circadian rhythm. And don’t give up when you overeat or binge eats every once in a while. Your circadian rhythm might be broken temporarily, but it is easy to get back to your routine again. #2. Drink Water  Having 1.5 to 2 liters of water a day can help you lose weight. Drinking water will boost your body’s metabolism and help you dispose of body waste. In addition, you burn calories when you consume water, and digesting water will further suppress your appetite. Here are some tips on how and when to drink water. >> Get up in the morning and drink a glass of water that is similar to your body temperature. >> Drink a glass of water one hour before and after your meal. >> Have about 4-5 cups when you are eating nothing. >> Drink water about 30 minutes before bedtime. If you follow these instructions, you can finish the prescribed (1.5 to 2L) amount of water in a day. If you want to enhance the smell of water, it’s a good idea to add a slice of lemon or lime. Give it a try. It’s free and easy habit that will help you lose weight! #3. Black Coffee  According to various studies, there are different opinions on whether coffee is good or bad for your diet. Personally, I strongly recommend drinking a cup of black coffee a day for losing weight. However, there are a few things to be careful of.You should drink only one cup of tea or coffee a day. More than two cups can take away moisture from the body.I recommend drinking black coffee in the morning. If you have coffee in the afternoon, it can bother your sleep pattern. You should only drink black coffee by itself without any snacks. #4. Shower  If you take a shower every day, it will help you lose weight too. Surprisingly, taking a shower helps burn calories and the calories that you can burn is higher than you think! And here is another daily tip while taking a shower. I always massage the lymph nodes in my body during a shower. The lymphatic system removes extra fluid and waste from the body. It also plays a role in immune function. The lymph nodes can be found in the neck, underarms, and in the groin. Make sure to press the inguinal lymph nodes 10 times gently. It will improve blood circulation and help release body waste as well.Try to do these things while you take a shower so it does not take time away from your other daily activities. It takes less than 5 mins! #5. Make Sure to Sleep Enough  Have you ever heard that you can lose weight while you sleep? A study found that sleeping an additional hour a day will help you lose about 10 pounds a year. Another study found that a lack of sleep will increase ghrelin (an appetite hormone), and decrease leptin (a hunger suppression hormone). Indeed, our body’s metabolism is really active during sleep.When we sleep, our bodies are not just sleeping, they are consuming energy and reorganizing our hormones in our bodies. Also, did you know that diet hormone are produced by your body while you sleep? According to recent studies, the best time to sleep is from 9 PM to 6 AM. If 9 hours sounds too difficult, then try to sleep for at least 7 hours a day. You will experience a weight loss miracle. Personally sleeping has helped me fast up to 14-16 hours every day without any difficulty.
